questions.question_text:
HOTSPOT -
A company is investigating Microsoft cloud services.
Instructions: For each of the following statements, select Yes if the statement is true. Otherwise, select No.
NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.
Hot Area:
//IMG//
questions.answer_description:
Box 1: Yes -
A public cloud is a web-based service model in which a hosting provider offers shared resources, like apps, servers and storage, to the general public. It's a multi- tenant environment, with different customers using the same pool of IT infrastructure. You pay for these shared resources on a pay-as-you-go basis.

Box 2: Yes -

Box 3: Yes -
Microsoft Azure is an example of a public cloud. In a public cloud, you share the same hardware, storage and network devices with other organizations or cloud
ג€tenants,ג€ and you access services and manage your account using a web browser.
Reference:
https://www.rackspace.com/library/what-is-a-public-cloud
https://www.techtarget.com/searchcloudcomputing/definition/Windows-Azure

discussion.content: correct
Owned and operated? Owned might be, I am not sure.But servers and storage are usually operated by IT staff. For me N N Y

comments.content: i had the same thought process, I operate my own data but they own the server
I am assuming they mean the media the data is on. The storage device.

discussion.content: So Microsoft owns your data in a public cloud?

choices.C: Use Windows AutoPilot to deploy devices
choices.B: Upgrade all client devices to Windows 10
choices.E: Deploy Microsoft Office 365 Professional Plus to all client devices

discussion.content: What a ridiculous question... none of those are going to change amount of time on support. They may even increase it! Not a good question.

comments.content: Agreed. These are more geared to promoting their products and not reducing support times.
lol. I'm an old guy trying to learn new tricks, so.....I agree completely and this has been a burr under my saddle. Thank you for confirming that there other people who feel the same.
Drink up that Kool-Aid. Oh yeah.
This whole cert seems to be about promoting their own products...

discussion.content: B C E CORECCT

This question is all about upgrading the question itself is bad, upgrade all device to win 10, assume they used win 7/8, deploy this devices using autopilot , use Microsoft office 365 assume upgrade from an old version of office

Para reduzir o tempo que a equipe de TI gasta no suporte ao usuário, considere as seguintes soluções:

1. **Atualize todos os dispositivos clientes para Windows 10:**
 - Padronizar em uma versão mais recente do sistema operacional simplifica o suporte, oferecendo recursos avançados e melhor gerenciamento de dispositivos.

2. **Use o Windows AutoPilot para implantar dispositivos:**
 - A automação do processo de provisionamento de dispositivos com o Windows AutoPilot pode reduzir significativamente o tempo gasto em configurações manuais.

3. **Implantar o Microsoft Office 365 Professional Plus em todos os dispositivos clientes:**
 - Padronizar a suíte de produtividade simplifica o suporte, proporcionando uma configuração mais consistente e aproveitando ferramentas de gerenciamento centralizado do Office 365.

Essas abordagens oferecem soluções completas para alcançar o objetivo de eficiência no suporte ao usuário.

Selected Answer: BCE
B C E CORECCT

Selected Answer: BCE

Selected Answer: BCE
It's B,C,E

FIY, 'A' would require interacting with the user which will waste valuable time. 'B' makes sense because they used the word "Upgrade" and not "Update", so I assume they mean upgrading from Win7/8 to Win10 which will save them time dealing with issues in the long run..
MS will always want you to upgrade. So B has to be one of the answers. I vote for BCE

Selected Answer: ACE
A C E why upgrade to Windows 10 when 8.1 is still supported.

comments.content: Because older updates will always run into compatibility issues, which will increase support time required

discussion.content: absolute nonsense question - how can you ascertain that will reduce user support. Not going to reduce user support if you just introduce autopilot and dont have a fully configured intune environment !

comments.content: No, MS will support your IT team. It will still need to be the IT team to communicate with the user.
Hence it reduces your own IT Team user support since MS will support the user and help troubleshoot.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BCE
Lockbox is only for MS support.
BCE correta

Customer lockbox and MyAnalytics have no meaning here as they serve different context. Customer lockbox is specifically to ensure Microsoft engineers cant access your env without your consent and at their will.

B C E - You need auto pilot to ensure that onboarding becomes automated. Vendor delivers laptop directly and its configured just by login. Can't happen without Windows 10 so comes B. Windows 10 means can be managed via Intune and policy/ apps can be pushed. VPN auto config, OneDrive auto-config, backup auto config etc. E because with Office, its self service installation without need of support

comments.content: one of the best explaination.

discussion.content: ACE is right
Implementing OS environments and tools with the property of more or less automated update/upgrade/deploy capabilities should help.

A. You need to delete a virus from a customer mailbox. Use Lockbox in place of scheduling a remote session with the customer.
B. Upgrade to W10 and enjoy maximum integration with cloud services. Also, you do not need to clarify with a client what OS do they use, do not need the specialists in legacy OSs and can rid of unnecessary knowledge and skills.
C. Use Windows AutoPilot and your clients (e.g., WFH) will only need to enter their credentials into the PC delivered to enroll it in Intune and get all apps and settings required.

D. Makes no sense.
E. Also. I have no clue why the help desk should get ease in supporting clients after installation of the desktop version of MSO. I would rather expect more questions e.g., why my Outlook does not work when I am offline. With Outlook Online the answer would be obvious, so the help desk would not be disturbed.
ACE are right.
B - Incorrect - How does migrating to Windows 10 reduces the IT time spent on User support?

comments.content: Complete solution requires Windows 10. Otherwise you will not be able to use Autopilot.

discussion.content:
A, C and E are right

D does not address the issue
B is incorrect too; upgrades require IT support

in order to choose between A and B, you must know.
1. Use Windows AutoPilot to deploy devices, (option"B" we all agree is part of a solution right) hence this is only supported only on Windows 10 "https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/mem/autopilot/windows-autopilot", now let go back to the question we cannot assume all users are on Windows 10, some others may be still on Windows 8, or 7 or Vista or worse XP." Assumption again" because let say, there are users who are on Windows 7 hence it means we not going to be able to use W.Autopilot on their devices. so we need to make sure we standardize the devices to make sure that all devices are supported for us to able to use W.Autopilot we need to upgrade all devices to Windows 10, hence Option B.

Option A, it is not possible to reduce the IT Support Team, duties simple  by applying Customer Lockbox, To me it seems like it will add more work because sometimes you will have to play as a middle man between myself as an IT guy, the Microsoft IT guy, and the End-user guy
I will be going with BCE
Correct B,C,E

I see is B,C,E correct 
why customer lockbox will reduce IT spport for user??
Guess ACE looks good as of now

I think it is B,C,E
the customer lockbox is to insure Microsoft cannot access customer content other than what they are being asked to support.

https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoft-365/compliance/customer-lockbox-requests?view=o365-worldwide

customer lockbox has nothing to do with end-users support.
https://social.technet.microsoft.com/wiki/contents/articles/35748.office-365-what-is-customer-lockbox-and-how-to-enable-it.aspx

Correct answers are B C E

comments.content:
In the link you have provided:
Office 365 Customer Lockbox feature which will help a customer to control how a Microsoft support engineer is going to access customer data during a scenario where customers have raised a support request to investigate some service issues related to customers Office 365 tenant.

Office 365 Customer Lockbox allows the customer to Approve or Reject access request made by the Microsoft Support engineers to access customer data. If customers give access by Approving the request, Microsoft Support Engineers will be able to access the data to help customers resolve issues if they deem necessary.
So it's make the support easier and faster... so I would say ACE.
I think Customer refers to Microsoft customer, I mean the company, not the final user.

discussion.content: FYI: Office 365 ProPlus now is Microsoft 365 Apps for enterprise
ACE is the correct Answer
i'll go for B C E
Lockbox has nothing to do with your IT team. It in fact adds up a task for admin. I will go for BCE
I think it is BCE, however I will read up on Office 365 Customer Lockbox

comments.content: Lockbox is certainly related to support to provide access to a MS support personnel through a process ( secure process) but supposedly cause delay than reduce time - IMO

discussion.content: BCE correct! Lockbox it's nothing to do with this question
ACE is correct

comments.content: Enabling lockbox will give support access to customer data where they need to troubleshoot or investigate. Answer is A, C and E

discussion.content: Option A will not reduce the time used on support, just makes it more secure

questions.question_text:
You need to reduce the amount of time that the IT team spends on user support.
What are three possible ways to achieve this goal? Each correct answer presents a complete solution.
NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

DRAG DROP -
An organization plans to deploy Microsoft Office to all employees.
You need to select the appropriate Office plans and minimize costs.
Which Office plans should you use? To answer, drag the appropriate Office plans to the correct options. Each Office plan may be used once, more than once, or not at all. You may need to drag the split bar between panes or scroll to view content.
NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.
Select and Place:
//IMG//

discussion.content:
Obsolete plan name.
Microsoft 365 Apps for enterprise - formerly Office 365 ProPlus

comments.content:
https://www.microsoft.com/en-ca/microsoft-365/enterprise/compare-office-365-plans
Correct

discussion.content: Correct. Proplus (Office Microsoft 365 Apps for enterprise)

In other question, it said that Office 365 ProPlus even not a license name.
In this question,Office 365 ProPlus is a normal product.
real redicurious question.

Only M365 can install on mutiple devices (maximum 5 devices), and receive updates and new fetures.

Office standard- receive updates, but it doesn't receive new features.
Also Office standard, for example- office 2019: can be activated in only 1 computer per product key. / If you want to use in more than 1 computer,then you have to buy multiple product keys.
Correto
This is correct
Correct

ProPlus on both

Standard versions do not receive new features
ProPlus needed to install on more than one device

discussion.content: The tricky thing about the first question is, that you have to deploy the app from intune in order to manage it. Of course, you can deploy apps from 3rd party stores with Intune, but if a user installed it from the app store directly, it's not a managed app for Intune...

questions.question_text:
HOTSPOT -
A company plans to deploy Microsoft Intune.
Which types of apps can be managed by Intune?
For each of the following statements, select Yes if the statement is true. Otherwise, select No.
NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.
Hot Area:
//IMG//

discussion.content: You can only view and print documents

Selected Answer: D
In reduced functionality mode, Microsoft 365 Apps remains installed on the device, but users can only view and print their documents.
Can only be D

questions.question_text:
You are the Microsoft 365 administrator for a company.
You install Microsoft Office 365 ProPlus on five devices. You deactivate the Microsoft Office 365 ProPlus license on one device.
Which task can you perform on the deactivated device?
